outgrow.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to grow too big for something
outgrow.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: They outgrow their clothes so quickly.
Harry outgrew his cot when he was about two.
outgrow.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to no longer do or enjoy something that you used to do, because you have grown older and changed
outgrow.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Most children eventually outgrow a tendency toward travel sickness.
outgrow.translation[0].definitions[2].de: if a business outgrows a building, it begins to have too many people or too much work to fit into the building
outgrow.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: His furniture-making business soon outgrew his garage.
outgrow.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to grow or increase faster than someone or something else
